notesStmt.note: Folio 2r: a notice of the presentation of the manuscript by ῾Azariah Ḥayim ben Sanguinetti to Yosef ῾Azulai, in cursive Sefardi script. Yitsḥaḳ Leṿi: inscribed in an Italian cursive scipt (folio 2r).Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active in the last quarter of the 16th and first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 1597 (folio 130v); see 61 , and appendix § 62-74.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pesaḳim of Isaiah of Trani, the younger, on the treatises of Sanhedrin, Makot, Shevu῾ot, and ῾Avodah zarah.

collation.p: 13 complete quires of 8 and 10 leaves, and 1 incomplete quire of 8 leaves at the end. Catchwords, marking the end of the quires, partially cut away in the trimming.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Isaiah of Trani. Pesakim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1068.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 28: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153).
